text:
*WP Devs, question for you, anyone run into issues with the  4.9.6(GDPR Compliance) update?*

I have about 20 sites that are at 4.9.5 but I’ve seen a couple articles claiming the update is major and that sites should be wary about updating(for fear of things breaking).

just wondering if it’s a lot of huff about nothing
I havent had any issues when updating
I updated two or three sites (two using a theme and one using a child theme). From what i could see everything was working as intended

I would recommend also installing this plugin with the new update <https://wordpress.org/plugins/gdpr-data-request-form/> as its the one thing missing from the update (a native request form). The guy who built the plugin worked on and contributed to the new update.
Appreciate the suggestion and letting me know about the success. I’m currently going through the sites kinda 1 by one and checking them out so far nothing significant has happened.

yea the biggest things are in the `Settings > Privacy` area where you can choose a privacy policy page or create one and then in the `Tools > Export/Erase Personal Data` other than that, its like a normal update from what I saw
